post.body: I'm going to have to commission here, then, next time I'm back home. I'm still sputtering over the $2 tree.
OMG. OMG. I am taking you shopping with me next time I'm back east.
Same with my guys. The Elmo obsession came first, from toys at school. The DVDs came later.
Dude! You need to switch the tree to a low-sodium diet.
Luckily for me, the Elmo phase was short for the guys. About six months each. It just seemed like six years.
Go for it if you can find a quiet one. :) Go for it anyway if you have a tolerance for being driven mad for months.
And if you want some excessively used Elmo DVDs for your collection, I'd be happy to ship them away. {{ducking}}
LOL. Stumbled across our old Elmos DVDs the other day and remembered those days -- not all together fondly. :)
What'll @girlmonkey sees that last one.
I've always said the craziest folks usually are the ones trying to hard to appear "normal." Whatever "normal" is.
EXACTLY! Laughing works for me, at least. :)
Part of dealing with dysfunction, I think, is admitting it. There are folks in my family who can't come close to admitting.
Whew! Coz I was afraid it was only me and only my grandmother. Not taking it nearly as personally now.
No help here. I'm struggling to convince myself.
It definitely will be. I processed it in glass jars. It'll be good for about a year. :)
Have an extra for me. Oh, how I miss Dunkin' Donuts.
Ooooh! And here I've been sitting trying to figure a new career path. It could have been as simple as robbing a bank.
I'd be too chicken to try to escape. But I woulda done great running the cell block. :)
Ya know, if I were inclined toward a life of crime that wouldn't be a bad plan. I'm very careful about not telegraphing plans
LOL. That's the same way I was when we still had a land line. Finally just ditched the land line.
And yes, I'm finished except for food. I'm thinking Tuesday on that,too. Gotta be strategic. I went on 12.24 last year. Eeek
Ya know, Tuesday might not be bad. Better than Saturday or Sunday and definitely better than Wednesday!
Sybil? Sybil? Are you there? Seriously, I used to run into the same issue when I was tweeting from work.
Ha! There's no place like the hospital for the holidays.
LOL. Funny way to put it that I totally understand. I'll follow this account, too.
Not that American made guarantees safe labeling either. At least not when you're allergic. But there's less melamine.
Tell me about it! First the toys, now the food. Buy American made! Good to see you this morning. :)
I'm with her on the Ghirardelli. I could eat a bag of those filled squares by myself. But they all have peanut warnings.
Wow. I'd never seen much of your photo work before. You flat good! Beautiful site, too.
I think it must be. And the bad part is, the 3yo will down it in under an hour.
Oh and this repair guy is just GREAT, playing right along with him. It's really cute and funny.
Oh, there are days when I wish! {{grin}}
Same sit here. Uh, not that you'll know coz you can't see my tweets. Others showing up for me 40 minutes later.
Your 5yo still naps? I'm in awe! Big Guy is intractable. Tricks don't even work much these days.
Happy Birthday! And have a five alarm burger for me. Jalapenos on the side, though -- they pile a ton on now.
Tattoo planning = good for development of fine motor skills. :)
As long as she's not born with a nose ring.
Would almost work for a girl. As long as it didn't sentence her to a life of glitter and sparkles.
Sounds like she's trying her darnedest tonight. :)
And ya know, if you decide against Girlmonkey A, Metallica Hinson has a nice ring to it.
THAT'S what you get for exposing making her Metallica family at such a tender age.
Sheesh, this IS late for you. Haven't seen you around in the "wee hours" for ages!
Food recall: Cambrooke Foods imitation cream cheese, low-protein peanut butter due to Listeria. http://tinyurl.com/5c7ye8
Lovin' the spambots today, which keep attaching Christmas present ideas to my "Gifts to die for post." It's about the Wal-Mart trampling.
ACK! Holiday stress setting in. Must remind myself of a post I wrote almost a year ago. http://tinyurl.com/6hnamy
Boots, while playing with the nativity scene: Mary has to go do her work. The daddy will watch Baby Jesus.
I'm so uncool I can't even get a shoe fetish right. http://tinyurl.com/5mpmar
It's great that more teens are learning a work ethic. But a $100 a week allowance? OMG. I really can't relate. http://tinyurl.com/6q5rno
2.5 gallons of BBQ sauce later I'm sick of my kitchen. But it takes care of gifts and Big Guy for a month or so. http://tinyurl.com/7z8k38
Food recall: G&J Gourmet Market Cocoa, due to melamine contamination http://tinyurl.com/9ju7cj
I found the Hershey Santas at Target this week.
Peanut-free find: Solid chocolate Santas by Hershey carry no contamination warning. Down side: 4 ounces of chocolate is REALLY too much!
Big Guy's my big man today, showing a repairman what needs fixed around the house. "I can handle it, Mom." Awwwwwwwww.
Recalls: Jardine cribs, children's jackets, bicycle forks, toasters http://www.cpsc.gov/
Oh, the joys of back to school after six weeks. It made Big Guy wanna shout. And he did. http://tinyurl.com/8yhjq9
Tweetdeck acting up on anyone else? Refresh shows only my tweets, and I'm not that fascinating. Other folks show up only after reboot.
A doctor snoops around MySpace and teens listen! Yes, it's true. http://tinyurl.com/7uf2j7
My mom sends the guys a set of train cookie cutters: good. Big Guy was at school so Boots thinks they're his alone: trouble.
The page view slutting on WashPost is just ridiculous. Six short paragraphs, two more pages of "next." Bigger numbers through annoyance!
I think Big Guy must work for TSA. He says ALL new clothes make him itchy. http://tinyurl.com/9drczy
